full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/18/2023 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE File No. A 10 294 862 - Boston, Massachusetts August 31, 1966 In the Matter of ) MAR DOO ) also known as ) IN DEPORTATION PROCEEDINGS MAR AU SANG ) ) ) Respondent) CHARGE: I & N Act, Sec. 241(a)(2) (8 U.S.C. 1251(a)(2)) Nonimmigrant crewman - remained longer APPLICATION: Suspension of Deportation - I & N Act, Sec. 244(a)(1) as amended (8 U.S.C. 1254(a)(1)) IN BEHALF OF RESPONDENT: IN BEHALF OF SERVICE: James J. Cody, Esquire No one 40 Court Street Boston, Massachusetts 02108 DECISION OF THE SPECIAL INQUIRY OFFICER DISCUSSION AS TO DEPORTABILITY: This record relates to a 57 year old, married, male alien, a native of China and citizen of the Republic of China. He entered the United States as a nonimmigrant crewman on April 30, 1955. That entry has been verified. He was permitted to remain as a nonimmigrant crewman while his vessel was in port but not to exceed 29 days. He has remained in the United States thereafter without authority. At a hearing in deportation proceedings at New York City, New York on October 2, 1956, the respondent admitted that he is deportable as charged in the Order to Show Cause. He was found to be deportable and - 1 -
